intro: Corydalis zhongdianensis, commonly known as the Zhongdian corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dark seeds. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
